mainEntity.name: Why Does Shopify Charge Transaction Fees?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Shopify charges transaction fees to cover the cost of maintaining its platform and processing payments. By using Shopify Payments, you can eliminate additional transaction fees that would apply if you used third-party providers like PayPal or Stripe.

mainEntity.name: How Can I Avoid Shopify's Transaction Fees?

acceptedAnswer.text: To avoid Shopify's transaction fees, use Shopify Payments. When you use Shopify Payments, you only pay standard credit card processing fees, which vary based on your subscription plan. Additionally, you can reduce fees by choosing the Advanced Plan, which offers the lowest transaction costs for high-volume sellers.

mainEntity.name: What Happens If I Use a Third-Party Payment Processor?

acceptedAnswer.text: When you use a third-party payment processor like PayPal or Stripe, Shopify charges an extra transaction fee on top of the provider's processing fees. This fee depends on your subscription plan: Basic Plan: 2.0% per transaction, Shopify Plan: 1.0% per transaction, Advanced Plan: 0.5% per transaction. Using Shopify Payments is the only way to avoid these additional fees.

No, Shopify Payments is not available in all countries. It is primarily available in countries like the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Australia, and several European countries. To check if Shopify Payments is available in your region, visit Shopify's official list of supported countries.

mainEntity.name: How Much Does Shopify Charge Per Sale for International Payments?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you sell internationally and accept payments in multiple currencies, Shopify applies a currency conversion fee when converting funds to your payout currency. United States: 1.5% per transaction. Other Regions: 2.0% per transaction. These fees are applied in addition to standard transaction fees.
